page.title: 05SKI CENTRE
page.content: The Lecht is 7 miles from Tomintoul on the Cockbridge road. The Ski Centre is open over the winter from nine to four each day. It has seven runs. The Wren, Robin and Petrel are easy. Kestrel, Osprey and Eagle are intermediate with Falcon being the most difficult. Two more tows are planned for next season. The prices for ski lessons and rental are very reasonable. The centre was established in the 1970's and in a good weekend it can take in over Â£3,000. The queues are large at the peak of the season but off-peak they can be very small, with very few skiers on the slopes. Locally we are lucky to have ski runs close by. Skiing is a very popular pastime with pupils at Tomintoul School and many of them are members of Tomintoul Ski Club.
